meanings.definition: To harden or solidify into stone.
meanings.sent1: The sun's heat is lithifying the clay into a hard brick.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the lava will be lithifying into solid rock.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion had an unexpected effect, lithifying everything it touched into stone!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a sculptor, lithifying her dreams into unbreakable statues.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush seemed to lithify the colors on the canvas, creating a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The process of turning into rock.
meanings.sent1: The lithifying of the ancient tree remains fascinated the scientists.
meanings.sent2: We could see the lithifying of the sediment layers over millions of years.
meanings.sent3: The museum displayed a unique exhibit on the lithifying of fossils.
meanings.sent4: Time felt like a slow lithifying, turning memories into solid stone.
meanings.sent5: The mountain's lithifying was a testament to the earth's enduring strength.
